body.p:
Recd 26th
P. 12
Cadiz Ky
May 23rd 1864
Your Exclellency
Tho Bramlette

In the deplorable condition of our County I am compelled to write to you for if Something isn't done the People will be entirely broken up -- we hear evry day the Stealing of Horses by Guerrillas Stores broken open & Pilliaged and plundered by these theiving bands -- our County has Several small band which are continually prowling along -- around I propose Sir that you give me Permission to raise a few men for the purpose of repelling these Scoundrels, the troops at Hopkinsville our nearest Military post affords us (Very little protection --
these men I propose to get up Can Mount, themselves or most of them and our rendevous will be Golden Ponds or near Cantron Ky

these men are for six months -- for which the County will be creditied by the reason I propose being Stationed at Ferngoner Golden Pond is that the Citizens an ^the^ furthest from any Military post of any Citizens in the County, are More Exposed being between the Rivers ^and^ are are in great danger of being broken up at any time the Supplies for the men can be had very Easily, from Paducah -- by way of ^the^ Rivers,
will be a very Easy thing to get one Hundred Men in this County for Six Months Service --
If you approve of the plan proposed I wish you would at once write me So that I can at once proceed to the work

Your Friend
R. V. Grinter
Late of 8th Ky Cavalry U, S,

Cadiz Ky
May 23d 1864
Grinter R. V.
To the Governor stating the condition of his section of country, here overrun by guerrillas &c and desires authority to recruit a company for 6 months

L B. No 4 -- 1864 P. 12
Recd A G. O. 26 May 1864
